                    {
                        "title": "[Bug]: Templates--Bad available_remaining tracking",
                        "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\n\n- [X] I have searched and found no existing issue\n\n### What happened?\n\n@shall0pass \r\nThe recent template speed up that is manually tracking the available_remaining gets messed up if there are multiple priority levels in the same category.\r\n\r\nSince the template processing includes previous priority level values in the to_budget variable, when subtracting to_budget from available_funds the previous pass values get removed again.  This will keep happening for every pass if there is a template with that priority level. \r\n\r\nEx\r\nStart with $50\r\nCat1  :`#template 10`, `#template-1 15`\r\nCat2: `#template remainder`\r\n\r\nThe remainder should should get $25 but will end up with $15 since the first $10 gets deducted twice from available_funds in the main loop.\r\n\r\n\r\nThere may be a quick way to fix this, but I wonder if the best way would be to reorganize how the templates are processed. So that the processing of a single template doesn't care about what was there before, and the top loop adds in the previous funds instead of the previous funds being added during the processing.  I would have to check all the processing to make sure that setup doesn't break anything.\n\n### What error did you receive?\n\n_No response_\n\n### Where are you hosting Actual?\n\nNone\n\n### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?\n\n_No response_\n\n### Operating System\n\nNone",
                        "label": "bug",

                        "title": "[Bug]: Simple Goal Templates compound when overwritting",
                        "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\n\n- [X] I have searched and found no existing issue\n\n### What happened?\n\nIt looks like the speed upgrade with the setZero change has made it so the simple template (`#template 10`) will compound when using the overwrite option instead of resetting to zero and then applying.  If I add an await to the setZero call it works as expected, but I imagine that loses most of the speed gains.                         "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\n\n- [X] I have searched and found no existing issue\n\n### What happened?\n\nAPI version:  `6.1.0`\r\nActual server version: `23.7.1`\r\n\r\nAfter upgrading the server (I think I was on `23.6.0` before) I'm now getting, on a fresh api install, `Error updating Error: out-of-sync-migrations`. \r\nI'm not familiar with this codebase, but I noticed that my local `node_modules/@actual-api/api/dist/migrations` and https://github.com/actualbudget/actual/tree/master/packages/loot-core/migrations (the only place where I found migrations) do seem out of sync. These files are missing in the api folder:\r\n- [1685375406832_transaction_filters.sql](https://github.com/actualbudget/actual/blob/master/packages/loot-core/migrations/1685375406832_transaction_filters.sql)\r\n- [1686139660866_remove_account_type.sql](https://github.com/actualbudget/actual/blob/master/packages/loot-core/migrations/1686139660866_remove_account_type.sql)\r\n\r\nBy manually adding them, I can sync again.\n\n### What error did you receive?\n\nError updating Error: out-of-sync-migrations\n\n### Where are you hosting Actual?\n\nDocker\n\n### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?\n\n_No response_\n\n### Operating System\n\nLinux",

                        "title": "[Bug]: Transaction entry - clicking \"enter\" when selection menu open creates a transaction",
                        "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\n\n- [X] I have searched and found no existing issue\n\n### What happened?\n\nReproduction steps:\r\n1. open transaction table\r\n2. click \"add new transaction\"\r\n3. date field becomes active; click \"enter\"\r\n4. an empty transaction is created\r\n\r\nThis issue was introduced in: https://github.com/actualbudget/actual/pull/992\r\n\r\nA better fix would be to create this transaction only if the popovers are closed.                         "title": "[Bug]: Can't use rules to match string fields by a Polish letter if it's at the beginning of a word",
                        "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\n\n- [X] I have searched and found no existing issue\n\n### What happened?\n\nI have transactions with an imported payee named \"Ing Bank Śląski S.A.\". I noticed that it is impossible to match them using `is` against that exact string *and* I noticed that when using `contains` instead, it only works as long as I match with anything that doesn't contain `Ś`, i.e. both \"Ing Bank\" and \"ląski S.A.\" are matching fine. It seems that the rules in Actual are having trouble with matching string fields by a Polish letter *if* that letter is the first letter of any word in the field. I've also been able to reproduce this with the \"Notes\" field.\r\n\r\nReproduction steps:\r\n1. Start a fresh Actual instance.\r\n2. Click on \"Try demo\"\r\n3. Choose any account (i.e. \"Ally Savings\")\r\n4. Click on import.\r\n5. Choose this file: [polish-letters-repro.csv](https://github.com/actualbudget/actual/files/11131125/polish-letters-repro.csv)\r\n6. Ensure CSV fields are properly matched, either of these configurations can be used for reproduction:\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6032823/229330652-b92737db-1511-4af7-988a-245370c3f7c9.png)\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6032823/229330666-8f098074-2d33-4842-8691-d10678bda843.png)\r\n7. After import, 4 transactions should be added:\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6032823/229330822-af693309-d5ab-489b-b3f3-871aff05529e.png)\r\n8. Go to the rules page and start creating a new rule.\r\n9. Depending on what you chose in step 6, choose the \"imported payee\" or \"notes\" field.\r\n10. Use the \"contains\" matcher (this can be reproduced with \"is\" as well but you can test it more easily with \"contains\")\r\n11. Type in any single Polish letter: `ĄĆĘŁŃÓŚŹŻąćęłńóśźż`\r\n12. See only 2 transactions even though 4 should match.                         "title": "[Bug]: Node 19 unsupported",
                        "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\r\n\r\n- [X] I have searched and found no related existing issue for `node 19` or `better-sqlite3`\r\n\r\n### What happened?\r\n\r\nWhen installing this repo, one dependency could repeatedly not be built: `better-sqlite3`!\r\n\r\nEventually, when I realized that fly.io was doing just fine with building the repo, and that they use `node@14`, I downgraded my local node version from `19.7.0` to the latest node@18: `18.14.2`. That did the trick.\r\n\r\nMy diagnosis is that `sql-lite3` version `^7.5.0` is not compatible with node@19.\r\n\r\nOne solution could be to upgrade it: it does look like [better-sqlite3](https://github.com/WiseLibs/better-sqlite3) on the latest version, `8.1.0`, installs just fine with the latest node! Unfortunately, there is no corresponding [@types/better-sqlite3](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@types/better-sqlite3) package released yet. The latest one, `7.6.3` doesn't seem to be compatible with node@19 either :/\r\n\r\nMaybe, in the meantime, in package.json, we could set the engines node version to be up to node@18 for easier debugging?\r\n\r\n\r\n### What error did you receive?\r\n\r\nIn terminal after `yarn install`:\r\n```\r\n➤ YN0009: │ better-sqlite3@npm:7.6.2 couldn't be built successfully (exit code 1, logs can be                         "title": "[Bug]: \"invalid schema\" shows misleading \"Update required\" error message",
                        "description": "### Verified issue does not already exist?\r\n\r\nI have searched and found no existing issue\r\n\r\n### What happened?\r\n\r\nAfter creating, removing and recreating a file on my laptop, sync broke on my iPad and was not able to make it work until I triggered reset sync from the laptop itself. The error message showing up on the iPad was \"Update required\" even if was using the latest web version directly from the server 😕 \r\n\r\nI thought the problem was on some cache on iPad, so deleted all data there (tried network caches, local dbs, ...) but Actual would still start syncing and then log an \"invalid schema\" error in the console.\r\nTurns out the problem (likely) was the server sending a partial file even when no file was available on the device. I saw from the logs that \"Got meta for documents-Actual-My-Finances-ea6e8ff-db.sqlite\" size was very different between the broken sync (300KB) vs when the full sync happened (1.1MB). \r\n\r\nI think it would be helpful to improve the messaging on the error (or have a complete different errors for these \"invalid schema\" exceptions) and provide a way for the device where this error occurs to discard local data and have the server send a full sync again.\r\n\r\nApp: 23.1.12 | Server: 23.1.12\r\n\r\n### What error did you receive?\r\n\r\n_No response_\r\n\r\n### Where are you hosting Actual?\r\n\r\nFly.io\r\n\r\n### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?\r\n\r\nSafari\r\n\r\n### Operating System\r\n\r\nMobile Device",

I'm self-hosting the Actual Docker image in a VM on my local network.\r\n\r\nI started testing Actual by forwarding port `5006` to my desktop.  I browsed to `http://localhost:5006` and created several budget Files in both Chrome and Firefox.  Things worked smoothly.  I was able to sync and see all File updates between Chrome and Firefox. \r\n\r\nSeeing this worked well, I wiped/restarted the Actual instance, and used the full URL to the Actual instance.  I started creating budget Files and found they were all getting merged together inconsistently.  I stopped, wiped/restarted the Actual instance again, flushed the entire cache in both Chrome and Firefox, and found the issue persisted.\r\n\r\nI also noticed Firefox showing `Error: Fallback mode unable to write file changes` in the dev console after I switched to the full URL.\r\n\r\nAs an aside, I've successfully hosted several other containers/services using this same full URL which gives me a level of confidence in my DNS setup.\r\n\r\nI've done my best to document how to re-create this issue below.  \r\n\r\n### Hosting Setup\r\n- Self-hosted Ubuntu VM running Docker engine on my local network, no reverse-proxy or other redirection\r\n- Used Docker Compose to spin up Actual version `jlongster/actual-server:22.12.9` \r\n- Here is the `docker-compose.yaml` file I'm using:\r\n```yaml\r\nversion: '3.3'\r\nservices:\r\n  actual-server:\r\n    image: jlongster/actual-server:22.12.9\r\n    restart: always\r\n    ports:\r\n      - 5006:5006\r\n    volumes:\r\n      - data:/data\r\n\r\nvolumes:\r\n  data:\r\n```\r\n\r\n### Steps to Replicate Issue\r\n- Start with fresh Docker container\r\n```sh\r\ndocker compose down -v   # Ensures named volume is wiped\r\ndocker compose pull\r\ndocker compose up -d\r\n```\r\n\r\n- On Windows 10, using Chrome or Firefox, navigate to `http://<full URL>:5006`\r\n- Complete server setup, create budget Files with identifiable Account names and starting amounts\r\n- As you close each budget File, open the other ones, and see Accounts from other budget Files are showing up\r\n\r\n### Video 1\r\nServer setup using Chrome, creation of budget Files, and how the budgets appear \"merged.\"\r\n\r\nhttps://user-images.githubusercontent.com/122043098/211085705-9e1a9516-c10e-454a-a2c6-3f7b72b203b6.mp4\r\n\r\n### Video 2\r\nThe \"merged\" budgets appear the same in Firefox.                     {
                        "title": "Update or remove `jwl-dev-utils`",
                        "description": "I've been looking at how to update various packages so we can increase the stability of the build process and support TS but  the dependency which is causing troubles with this is `jwl-dev-utils`. This seems to be a fork of `react-dev-utils` which is maintained by @jlongster.\r\n\r\nIn order to update the codebase to use TS we need a TS compatible linter (#110), swapping out babel for tslint's parser as otherwise the linter will error on any .ts files.\r\n\r\nThe issue with this however is we need to update eslint as we're using a version released in 2018 whereas [v1.0.0 of typescript-eslint](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/releases/tag/v1.0.0) was released in 2019. Updating `eslint` causes incompatibilities with `eslint-loader`, and in turn updating that causes incompatibilities with `jwl-dev-utils`.\r\n\r\n`jwl-dev-utils` has had a number of patches applied relative to `react-dev-utils` (but these patches don't seem to have been pushed to github). This means that it's hard to know exactly what code is running and how it's different from `react-dev-utils`. Not knowing how the code differs from `react-dev-utils` makes it difficult to easily rollback to the official version of `react-dev-utils` so we can start migrating forwards to more recent versions (builds start failing when replacing it with the most similar version of `react-dev-utils`).\r\n\r\n@jlongster could you publish what these changes are and potentially help with updating these dependencies as this seems to be a blocker for many priorities and there's info about this which only you can provide?",
                        "label": "unlabeledBug",
                        "createdAt": "2022-07-08T22:11:53Z",
                        "closedAt": "2022-07-24T04:17:07Z",
                        "lastComment": "",
                        "commentCount": 0

We're using bash features in these scripts so they're failing on my machine and CI with `sh`.\r\n#73 Adds a github action CI to check that we can build all the various outputs on any PR.\r\n\r\n### 3.3 Linter checks\r\n\r\n#70 Adds a github action CI to check for any linter errors in `loot-core`\r\n\r\n## 4 Fixes\r\n\r\n#59 Fixes the broken Timestamp test suite and updates the `Timestamp` implementation to enforce the proper validity checks.\r\n#102 Fixes a broken test by scaling up some values so they're all integers.\r\n\r\n## 5 Reorganising code\r\n\r\nThese shouldn't change functionality at all, I'm mostly just moving code around so that it's easier to read/import:\r\n\r\n#64 Group `timestamp.js` and `merkle.js` into a `crdt` directory as they're intrinsically linked.\r\n#68 Create a single entrypoint for importing AQL code rather than reaching into multiple different files in the `aql` directory\r\n#83 Breaks the functions contained in `db/index` up into multiple files based on which sort of data they're working on.\r\n\r\n## 6 Migration to typescript\r\n\r\nThese PRs are going to muck with CI and have a bunch of merge conflicts with the PRs above. I can rebase these on top of master once we get closer to the point of merging.\r\n\r\n### 6.1 Migrate to Yarn v3\r\n\r\nThis isn't necessarily a hard requirement for migrating to typescript but it definitely simplifies it. Running tests in a monorepo is much simpler in yarn v3 so I'd strongly recommend making this change so we can get rid of some of the hacks around testing.\r\n\r\n#50 Upgrades from yarn v1 to yarn v3\r\n\r\n### 6.1 Migrate tests\r\n\r\nBefore we can migrate the code, we need to migrate how we run the tests. Otherwise we end up trying to import Typescript code and then jest doesn't know what to do with it. If we swap out `babel-jest` for `ts-jest` the tests run fine without any modification and will still work once we add typescript to the mix.\r\n\r\nI'm not making a PR for this just yet as the diff is so noisy with required prerequisite changes that it's not really worth looking at yet.                     {
                        "title": "RFC: Sunset Client Side Encryption",
                        "description": "## Introduction\r\n\r\nThis is a request for comment (RFC) on if client-side encryption should be sunset in Actual OSS. \r\n\r\nActual clients support syncing between many instances using a centralized server (sync server). As clients make modifications, the changes to their internal state are set to the sync server to be received and applied by other individual client instances.\r\n\r\nFurther, under Actual (in the before times), the client supported encrypting all data locally before the data was sent to the sync server, as documented [here (end-to-end-encryption)](https://actualbudget.com/docs/overview/syncing-across-devices/#end-to-end-encryption).\r\n\r\nEffectively, client side encryption allows for a zero-trust model for the syncing server. The end-user could assume both the data was encrypted on disk in a format that even the operator of the server would not be able to access.\r\n\r\n### Terminology\r\n\r\nWhen I refer to the sync server, I refer to a hypothetical server that only handles syncing of encrypted data between clients. The OSS server is functionally different from the previous implementation.\r\n\r\nWhen I refer to a client, I refer to the full-fat clients in the model of the before times Actual e.g. the Mobile client and the Electron Desktop client. The OSS server blurs the lines.\r\n\r\n## Proposal\r\n\r\nIn Actual OSS, servers are hosted and maintained by the same individuals using the Actual OSS client. These individuals may employ full-disk encryption or other security measures if they believe such protections are warranted. Since there is no longer a third-party operator who may have access to the Actual data, the zero-trust model is less useful.\r\n\r\nClient-side encryption should be considered for removal from Actual OSS.\r\n\r\n### Pro Removal\r\n\r\n- The original security concerns are moved to individuals, allowing them to choose their threat model. \r\n- Not only is this client-encryption less useful, the encryption introduces additional complexities:\r\n  - Additional error checking is required.\r\n  - Additional API surface area needs to be maintain.\r\n  - Multiple logic flows (encrypted and unencrypted) would need to be tested and maintained.\r\n  - The server is unable to modify the Actual data without the involvement from a client. This may make largely desired features, such as automatic bank import, more difficult.\r\n  - etc.\r\n- Encryption is currently not supported by the OSS server per this comment: https://github.com/actualbudget/actual-server/blob/44d045f546ceb2440f2a681bc5821bbb8eefb80f/app-sync.js#L126-L135 Additional work will be required to support client-side encryption.\r\n\r\n### Against Removal\r\n\r\n- Some individuals may not have the technical ability to secure a server effectively (e.g. full disk encryption is only useful with physically protected, physical hardware, which may be out of scope for many). Services like https://fly.io/ should be considered as the lowest common denominator that should still support a secure encryption model.\r\n- Client side encryption is a features that is best added at the beginning of development. The code largely already exists and should be maintained.\r\n- If a community maintained cloud service is every considered again (similar to https://www.home-assistant.io/cloud/), client-side encryption would be largely desirable. \r\n\r\n## Commentary\r\n\r\n- I personally found this client-side encryption feature a major factor in ultimately selecting Actual for personal use. I still believe client-side encryption is a killer feature.\r\n- I personally run full-disk encryption on my own infrastructure, and while I support the inclusion of any time of client-side encryption (and would actively use it), the developer side of me likes the idea of being able to modify Actual data from the server without a client (aka a developer API). I would want to prioritize features like Plaid fetching or stock value tracking over client-side encryption - as I personally can secure the Actual data in a way that is acceptable.\r\n",
                        "label": "unlabeledBug",
                        "createdAt": "2022-05-05T00:20:49Z",
                        "closedAt": "2022-08-15T17:56:58Z",
                        "lastComment": "2022-08-03T05:16:14Z",
                        "commentCount": 8
                    },

                    {
                        "title": "Synced files don't belong in synced locations",
                        "description": "I could swear I've seen this elsewhere, but I can't find the issue, so I'm making sure it's not missed.  The Actual files are kept in sync using Actual's own processes and service.  Therefore, they should be stored in explicitly-local folders rather than in folders which are prone to syncing by some other service.  Both Windows and Mac have services to sync the Documents folder; colliding changes from two different sync services produce results like this:\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4273797/144867149-935c96f9-732e-4ec4-a334-754a52acd633.png)\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4273797/144867333-d535513b-acca-4b82-802d-43fcb0ec3715.png)\r\n\r\nI don't know what the proper location would be on a Mac, but in Windows, you probably want %LOCALAPPDATA% -- this contains files which are synced neither by OneDrive nor by Roaming User Profiles.  (There's perhaps an argument for %APPDATA% instead, which *is* synced by Roaming User Profiles, but the sync is completed before login.)",

                        "createdAt": "2021-12-06T14:58:28Z",

                        "title": "[BUG]: Windows多屏幕下，弹窗显示位置错误",
                        "description": "### Please confirm the following before submitting a new issue.\r\n\r\n- [X] I have carefully reviewed the official website's usage documentation.\r\n- [X] I have searched through the historical issues but could not find an answer.\r\n\r\n### Description\r\n\r\n### 弹窗位置向上偏移，现象如下：\r\n![image](https://github.com/pot-app/pot-desktop/assets/30779939/8e5822fe-ad11-48e3-b22b-36c2b33f2fdd)\r\n### 原因是我的屏幕设置如下，出问题位置是箭头指向：\r\n![image](https://github.com/pot-app/pot-desktop/assets/30779939/7b750a81-723b-47e5-b01b-9cd0056349ef)\r\n### 问题原因：\r\n可以看到屏幕1是主显示器并且屏幕1要比屏幕2高，然后通过WINAPI获取的y坐标是按照屏幕1为基准计算的，所以导致处理屏幕2边界情况的代码出现了问题。\r\n相关代码在这里：\r\n```rust\r\nfn convert_mouse_location(\r\n    location: (f64, f64),\r\n    monitor: tauri::Monitor,\r\n) -> Result<(f64, f64), String> {\r\n    let (mut x, mut y) = location;\r\n    let (width, height) = get_window_size();\r\n    let monitor_size = monitor.size();\r\n    let dpi = monitor.scale_factor();\r\n    x /= dpi;\r\n    y /= dpi;\r\n    if x + width > monitor_size.width as f64 / dpi {\r\n        x -= width;\r\n        if x < 0.0 {\r\n            x = 0.0;\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n    // 这里限制y导致了问题，去掉后显示正常\r\n    if y + height > monitor_size.height as f64 / dpi {\r\n        y -= height;\r\n        if y < 0.0 {\r\n            y = 0.0;\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    Ok((x, y))\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n### Reproduction\r\n\r\n见Description\r\n\r\n### Platform\r\n\r\nWindows\r\n\r\n### System Version\r\n\r\nWindows11\r\n\r\n### Window System(Linux Only)\r\n\r\nNone\r\n\r\n### Software Version\r\n\r\n_No response_\r\n\r\n### Additional Information\r\n\r\n_No response_",
                        "label": "bug",
                        "createdAt": "2023-06-01T01:57:21Z",
                        "closedAt": "2023-06-01T02:04:33Z",
                        "lastComment": "2023-06-01T02:36:01Z",
                        "commentCount": 2
                    },

                        "title": "[BUG]: 开启 OpenAi 流式输出后，翻译界面变空白",
                        "description": "### 问题描述\n\n使用 OpenAi 流式翻译后，翻译界面整体会变空白，具体表现是 \r\n1、出现翻译窗口\r\n2、展示默认内容\r\n3、整个窗口变为白色\r\n\r\n> GIF 示例\r\n ![pot-bug](https://github.com/pot-app/pot-desktop/assets/31335418/9c2fafe8-d526-4197-b7c8-5ef807706b61)\r\n\r\n另外非常感谢作者提供如此优秀的开源软件。\n\n### 如何复现\n\n1、配置 OpenAi 翻译设置。\r\n2、`翻译设置 - 默认接口` 改为 OpenAi。\r\n3、翻译设置中勾选 `OpenAi 流式输出`\r\n4、选中单词，执行翻译，问题出现。\r\n\r\n测试过程中，如果取消勾选 `OpenAi 流式输出`，则 OpenAi 翻译功能能够成功翻译并展示界面。\r\n\r\nPS：首次翻译过程中，翻译了比较大量的文本，或许有可能是此原因导致流式输出出现问题，但此猜测未经过验证。另外系统本地并无代理设置。\n\n### 操作系统\n\nWindows (Default)\n\n### 操作系统版本\n\nWindows 11 家庭中文版\r\n版本：22H2 (22621.1702)\n\n### 窗口系统(Linux Only)\n\nNone\n\n### 软件版本\n\npot:0.3.4  \r\nTauri:1.3.0\r\n\r\nPot 使用了 SnipDo\n\n### 补充信息\n\n_No response_",

                        "description": "I have a number of images generated using a LoRA in the prompt.                         "sha": "e41c4e42baacb1f8f8f53e61dbede2f5e1cdf993"

                    {
                        "message": "DB Migration + Global Filter + Remove flicker\n\n1. DB Migration: Previously the app was using a single database named \"breadboard\". This is a bad design because it contains both the file metadata table as well as user specific data (such as favorites, settings, etc.). In this version, The db has been separated into 2: \"data\" database and \"user\" database. The \"data\" database simply stores the file metadata, and it's totally fine if the entire database gets corrupted or deleted because breadboard can always recrawl from the files. The \"user\" database includes all the user specific data that cannot be retrieved from files, such as favorites table, checkpoints table, folders table, and settings table. This makes it much easier to upgrade the schema and also makes the database portable and exportable.\n2. Global Queries: You can now set ANY favorited query as \"global\", and this query will be automatically applied to every query by default (in the background). For example if you set \"-tag:nsfw\" and \"-file_path:txt2img-grids\" as global queries, when you enter 'cat', the search bar will only display \"cat\", but the search result will return the same result as \"cat -tag:nsfw -file_path:txt2img-grids\"\n3. Removed the flickering issue whenever the page refreshes",

Components/SideEditors/GroupItemEditor/GroupItemEditor.razor\r\n```\r\n            <InputSelect Page=\"GroupItem\" TItem=\"string\" Label=\"Type\" @bind-Value=\"@Model.ItemType\">\r\n                <InputSelectOption TItem=\"string\" StringValue=\"DashboardApp\" Label=\"App\" />\r\n                <InputSelectOption TItem=\"string\" StringValue=\"DashboardLink\" Label=\"Link\" />\r\n                <InputSelectOption TItem=\"string\" StringValue=\"Dashboard\" Label=\"Dashboard\" />\r\n                <InputSelectOption TItem=\"string\" StringValue=\"DashboardTerminal\" Label=\"Terminal\" />\r\n            </InputSelect>\r\n```\r\n\r\nBut \"save\" task have only case \"DashboardApp\" and \"DashboardLink\" in Components/SideEditors/GroupItemEditor/GroupItemEditor.razor.cs\r\n\r\nSo if we choose Dashboard or DashboardTerminal option, go thrue exception /app/Components/SideEditors/GroupItemEditor/GroupItemEditor.razor.cs:line 327\r\n",

                    {
                        "title": "__uv.db is not assigned a value and bug of saving cookies to IDB",
                        "description": "https://github.com/titaniumnetwork-dev/Ultraviolet/blob/3f920ee7b4ac35b429a7fa9c38baaec1615e2b1f/src/uv.handler.js#L297-L306\r\nWhen there is a document.cookie written on the page, it will be overwritten and written into iDB by the code here. However, the uv.handler does not assign a value to __uv.db, so it is always undefined and cannot be written into idb. Changing it to await __uv.cookie.db() allows writing into idb.\r\n```\r\n client.document.on('setCookie', async (event) => {\r\n        Promise.resolve(\r\n            __uv.cookie.setCookies(\r\n                event.data.value,\r\n                await __uv.cookie.db(),\r\n                __uv.meta\r\n            )\r\n        ).then(() => {\r\n            __uv.cookie.db().then((db) => {\r\n                __uv.cookie.getCookies(db).then((cookies) => {\r\n                    cookieStr = __uv.cookie.serialize(cookies, __uv.meta, true);\r\n                });\r\n            });\r\n        });\r\n        const cookie = __uv.cookie.setCookie(event.data.value)[0];\r\n\r\n        if (!cookie.path) cookie.path = '/';\r\n        if (!cookie.domain) cookie.domain = __uv.meta.url.hostname;\r\n\r\n        if (__uv.cookie.validateCookie(cookie, __uv.meta, true)) {\r\n            if (cookieStr.length) cookieStr += '; ';\r\n            cookieStr += `${cookie.name}=${cookie.value}`;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        event.respondWith(event.data.value);\r\n    });\r\n```\r\nThe following code is to store cookies from different websites in separate IDBs, and everything seems fine.\r\nhttps://github.com/titaniumnetwork-dev/Ultraviolet/blob/3f920ee7b4ac35b429a7fa9c38baaec1615e2b1f/src/uv.handler.js#L413-L415\r\nBut when uv.sw.js processes the injected cookie information in the HTML header, it does not modify the name of idb. Therefore, only the cookie of _op database can be retrieved here instead of the proxy website's cookie, which causes a bug.\r\nhttps://github.com/titaniumnetwork-dev/Ultraviolet/blob/3f920ee7b4ac35b429a7fa9c38baaec1615e2b1f/src/uv.sw.js#L108-L113\r\n\r\n\r\nFinally, I had to comment out the code that modifies the IDB database name. This way, all cookies are saved in the _op database and now it seems to be working fine.\r\n```\r\n  client.idb.on('idbFactoryOpen', () => {\r\n        //event.data.name = `${__uv.meta.url.origin}@${event.data.name}`;\r\n    });\r\n```",
                        "label": "unlabeledBug",
                        "createdAt": "2023-03-23T09:31:05Z",
                        "closedAt": "2023-03-25T13:08:49Z",
                        "lastComment": "2023-03-25T02:44:15Z",
                        "commentCount": 3
                    },
                    {

                    {
                        "title": "Generate site sources with lightweight templating",
                        "description": "Having to modify headers in all .html is annoying. Bundling all the .js would also be nice. I'm writting a tiny site generator with the most basic templating possible. This will require restructuring of the site/ folder hierarchy.\r\n\r\n- `site/data`: the new location of `momentum-cart.json`. We may want to add default carts or other data in the future.\r\n- `site/js`: vendored third party JS dependencies, e.g. AlaSQL and Chart.js\r\n- `site/`: `.html` and `.js` files for each page of the site. Also contains files beginning with an `_`, like `_header.html`.\r\n\r\nThe  generator is given the `site/` directory as an input directory, and an arbitrary output directory. It will then:\r\n\r\n1. For each file in the input directory recursively\r\n    1. If the file starts with `_`, ignore it\r\n    1. Load the content of the file and replace any occurance of `%%$filename%%` with the contents of `$filename`. The `$filename` is given relative to the currently processed file\r\n    1. Write the content to the output directory\r\n\r\nThe generator is called both by `server.js` (previously `index.js`) and `pages.js`. The server will also watch the input directory for changes and regenerate the output accordingly. The `latest-canonical.${store}.compressedjson` files will be directly written to the output directory.\r\n\r\nNo, I do not want to use a pre-existing \"solution\". There's nothing as lightweight out there.\r\n\r\nRFC @iantsch @mhochsteger @simmac @pretzelhands @slhck before I fuck shit up.\r\n",

                    {
                        "title": "Moar users!!",
                        "description": "I think a lot of people could profit from this awesome software. Unfortunately, getting it up and running is not easy enough for the average billa/spar/hofer customer.\r\n\r\nI tried an easy setup, which might be beneficial for Windows (and potentially also MacOS or Linux) users:\r\n- Download and extrace node.js Windows Binary (.zip)\r\n- Put in the `heissepreise` src alongside `node` (two directories)\r\n- add following script (`run.bat`)\r\n```bat\r\ncd heissepreise\r\ncall ..\\node\\npm install\r\nstart \"\" http://localhost:3000\r\ncall ..\\node\\node.exe index.js\r\npause\r\n```\r\n-> Zip this result and provide it here as binary release for windows. Automating this steps is quite easy (and no need to certify executables etc., but larger release size (30mb in my test) )\r\n\r\nTo install it, you just need to download and extract a zip file, and double-click `run.bat`\r\n\r\nI did test this on Windows with the following code: https://github.com/mhochsteger/heissepreise/tree/local_deployment\r\nOnly two changes needed: Path fixes (`path.sep` instead of `/`), host `site` as static directory (no separate web server)\r\n\r\nOpen questions:\r\n- How to do updates? (use node script to check for and download source release from github?) \r\n- Any plans on an Android app? (that would be an even greater boost, but I have no expertise here)",

swiffyslider.initSlider(sliderRef.current)\r\n  }, [])\r\n\r\n  return (\r\n    <section id={_metadata.uid} className=\"content-list bg-dawn-grey-10 standard-padding\">\r\n      <Container width={274}\r\n                        height={204}\r\n                        objectFit={\"cover\"}\r\n                        layout={\"responsive\"}\r\n                        alt={item.image.title.replace(/\\.[^/.]+$/, \"\")}\r\n                      />\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    {item.overlay_content.show_overlay == true &&                         "label": "unlabeledBug",
                        "createdAt": "2023-07-02T03:02:37Z",
                        "closedAt": "2023-07-15T00:34:26Z",
                        "lastComment": "2023-07-11T20:22:03Z",
                        "commentCount": 1
                    },
                    {
                        "title": "How to make prebuilt packages [NOT AN ISSUE]",
                        "description": "So ArRPC is a real lifesaver for me as I use Vencord. But it requires node environment and I can't add it to windows autostart (and also obligated to have console window all the time). You may have other reasons to have prebuilt binaries, but whatever\r\n\r\n1. Install `esbuild` and `pkg`:\r\n```bash\r\nnpm i -g esbuild pkg\r\n```\r\n2. Wrap that async statement in async function and call it\r\n```diff\r\n\r\nimport * as Bridge from './bridge.js';\r\nimport Server from './server.js';\r\n\r\n- const server = await new Server();\r\n\r\n- server.on('activity', data => Bridge.send(data));\r\n+ async function main() {\r\n+     const server = await new Server();\r\n+     server.on('activity', data => Bridge.send(data));\r\n+ }\r\n\r\n+ main();\r\n```\r\n3. Bundle to single file via esbuild (node ≤ 18, node19 is not supported yet by `pkg`):\r\n```bash\r\nesbuild --bundle --platform=node --target=node18 --outdir=dist .\\src\\index.js\r\n```\r\n4. Build executable:\r\n```bash\r\npkg -t node18-win-x64 -o arrpc  .\\dist\\index.js #Windows amd64,  Node 18.x\r\npkg -t node18-linux-x64 -o arrpc  .\\dist\\index.js #Linux amd64, Node 18.x\r\npkg -t node18-macos-x64 -o arrpc  .\\dist\\index.js #MacOS amd64, Node 18.x\r\n```\r\n5. Voila!\r\n![Screenshot guyes look](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38406005/222386974-be029dff-2989-4c6e-85cb-39e4f5514030.png)\r\n\r\n6. It works perfectly fine (for now), but might require further testing\r\n",

                    {
                        "title": "Deprecated altool used for notarization of macOS build",
                        "description": "The project build system uses [the `electron-notarize` package](https://github.com/electron/notarize) to [notarize](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/security/notarizing_macos_software_before_distribution) the macOS builds of the application.\r\n\r\nBy default, this package uses the **altool** command-line utility for notarization:\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/electron/notarize#method-notarizeopts-promisevoid\r\n\r\n> `tool` String - The notarization tool to use, default is `legacy`.  Can be `legacy` or `notarytool`. `notarytool` is substantially (10x) faster.\r\n\r\nSince [this project does not set the `tool` option](https://github.com/arduino/lab-micropython-editor/blob/1d87f82f3c9c24409ba831ba3720bd68a39639fa/build_resources/notarize.js#L37-L42), it is using the default `legacy`.\r\n\r\nUsing **altool** for notarization is now deprecated and is scheduled to be disabled 2023-11-01:\r\n\r\nhttps://developer.apple.com/news/?id=y5mjxqmn\r\n\r\nEven though it is not immediately necessary to make this change, there is no technical reason to wait until the last minute to make the switch to **notarytool**. Doing so sooner would allow the migration to be done in a calm manner and with the option of temporarily reverting the build system back to using **altool** if some problem was identified during the migration. In addition, the claim is that the system will be significantly more efficient with **notarytool** so the migration has benefits beyond simply avoiding the breakage in November.",
                        "label": "unlabeledBug",
                        "createdAt": "2023-06-14T08:44:31Z",
                        "closedAt": "2023-06-16T06:57:12Z",
                        "lastComment": "",
                        "commentCount": 0

                        "title": "Lockfile version not supported by build npm version",
                        "description": "`package-lock.json` was recently updated to [lockfile format version 2](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v8/configuring-npm/package-lock-json#lockfileversion):\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/arduino/lab-micropython-editor/commit/0287453ffeb0895a2dea9d82a6ac14b05ebd9552#diff-053150b640a7ce75eff69d1a22cae7f0f94ad64ce9a855db544dda0929316519R4\r\n\r\nHowever, Node.js 14.x is used to build the project:\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/arduino/lab-micropython-editor/blob/7cb19bded3f336a2a74cb0bedb310401f5c9bcc4/.github/workflows/build.yml#L40\r\n\r\nNode.js 14.x uses npm version 6.x, which uses lockfile format version 1:\r\n\r\nhttps://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v8/configuring-npm/package-lock-json#lockfileversion:~:text=The%20lockfile%20version%20used%20by%20npm%20v5%20and%20v6\r\n\r\nContributors should always use a standardized Node.js version in order to ensure the behavior of the productions builds will match that of their own testing. With the updated lockfile format, the contributors using Node.js 14 will experience a confusing large diff in `package-lock.json` after running `npm install` due to that command automatically converting the file back to version 1 when ran with npm version 6.x.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nI recommend defining the standardized version of Node.js via the `engines.node` key of `package.json` to ensure all contributors use the correct version:\r\n\r\nhttps://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v8/configuring-npm/package-json#engines",

                    {
                        "title": "Not saving or uploading big files",
                        "description": "Both saving or uploading big files to the board fail. This is a known problem from Fabulous Flying Circus.\r\n\r\n**This will work:**\r\n<img width=\"812\" alt=\"Screenshot 2022-05-22 at 22 14 50\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/954594/169714107-4bf7c615-f1cd-43fd-959c-8a4018522ca2.png\">\r\n\r\n**But this will fail:**\r\n<img width=\"812\" alt=\"Screenshot 2022-05-22 at 22 13 08\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/954594/169713999-c7970d42-8437-45f1-8fdb-fa2409d3002f.png\">\r\n\r\nAnd after a noisy print of the text, when it fails, it prints on console the reason for it:\r\n\r\n<img width=\"812\" alt=\"Screenshot 2022-05-22 at 22 19 30\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/954594/169714240-b5dea588-cf03-4b0a-9796-245bc276c531.png\">\r\n\r\n```\r\nTraceback (most recent call last):\r\n  File \"<stdin>\", line 1\r\nSyntaxError: invalid syntax\r\n>>> \r\n```\r\n\r\nI tracked it down to being some sort of memory allocation problem when pasting large amount of data on raw repl. To overcome that I relied more on memory allocation on MicroPython, which also broke.\r\n\r\n<img width=\"695\" alt=\"Screenshot 2022-05-21 at 08 35 42\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/954594/169714330-2dcabbe0-79b2-44d4-9eaa-f513e0b1a7f1.png\">\r\n\r\n<img width=\"594\" alt=\"Screenshot 2022-05-21 at 08 30 43\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/954594/169714335-ecdfafd8-5920-4131-b151-5dcb2baacc6c.png\">\r\n\r\nIn prevous attempts to fix this in Fabulous Flying Circus I have sliced and throtled the messages I'm sending to the board. It was just recently that I found out reading the contents of a script called `pyboard.py` to investigate better ways to do it.\r\n\r\n```\r\n# pyboard.py\r\n# This file is part of the MicroPython project, http://micropython.org/\r\n#\r\n# The MIT License (MIT)\r\n#\r\n# Copyright (c) 2014-2021 Damien P. George\r\n# Copyright (c) 2017 Paul Sokolovsky\r\n```\r\n\r\nI learned about the existance of \"raw paste mode\" and found this part of the code specially relevant to this bug:\r\n\r\n```\r\ndef exec_raw_no_follow(self, command):\r\n  if isinstance(command, bytes):\r\n      command_bytes = command\r\n  else:\r\n      command_bytes = bytes(command, encoding=\"utf8\")\r\n\r\n  # check we have a prompt\r\n  data = self.read_until(1, b\">\")\r\n  if not data.endswith(b\">\"):\r\n      raise PyboardError(\"could not enter raw repl\")\r\n\r\n  if self.use_raw_paste:\r\n      # Try to enter raw-paste mode.\r\n      self.serial.write(b\"\\x05A\\x01\")\r\n      data = self.serial.read(2)\r\n      if data == b\"R\\x00\":\r\n          # Device understood raw-paste command but doesn't support it.\r\n          pass\r\n      elif data == b\"R\\x01\":\r\n          # Device supports raw-paste mode, write out the command using this mode.\r\n          return self.raw_paste_write(command_bytes)\r\n      else:\r\n          # Device doesn't support raw-paste, fall back to normal raw REPL.\r\n          data = self.read_until(1, b\"w REPL; CTRL-B to exit\\r\\n>\")\r\n          if not data.endswith(b\"w REPL; CTRL-B to exit\\r\\n>\"):\r\n              print(data)\r\n              raise PyboardError(\"could not enter raw repl\")\r\n      # Don't try to use raw-paste mode again for this connection.\r\n      self.use_raw_paste = False\r\n\r\n  # Write command using standard raw REPL, 256 bytes every 10ms.\r\n  for i in range(0, len(command_bytes), 256):\r\n      self.serial.write(command_bytes[i : min(i + 256, len(command_bytes))])\r\n      time.sleep(0.01)\r\n  self.serial.write(b\"\\x04\")\r\n\r\n  # check if we could exec command\r\n  data = self.serial.read(2)\r\n  if data != b\"OK\":\r\n      raise PyboardError(\"could not exec command (response: %r)\" % data)\r\n```\r\n\r\nI'm guessing all is needed is to align the contents of `_executeRaw` with the javascript version of `exec_raw_no_follow`.\r\n\r\n`exec_raw_no_follow` depends on `read_until` and `raw_paste_write` but for the sake of simplicity and compatibility it can depend only on `read_until`, which talks directly with the serial connection.\r\n\r\n```\r\ndef read_until(self, min_num_bytes, ending, timeout=10, data_consumer=None):\r\n    # if data_consumer is used then data is not accumulated and the ending must be 1 byte long\r\n    assert data_consumer is None or len(ending) == 1\r\n\r\n    data = self.serial.read(min_num_bytes)\r\n    if data_consumer:\r\n        data_consumer(data)\r\n    timeout_count = 0\r\n    while True:\r\n        if data.endswith(ending):\r\n            break\r\n        elif self.serial.inWaiting() > 0:\r\n            new_data = self.serial.read(1)\r\n            if data_consumer:\r\n                data_consumer(new_data)\r\n                data = new_data\r\n            else:\r\n                data = data + new_data\r\n            timeout_count = 0\r\n        else:\r\n            timeout_count += 1\r\n            if timeout is not None and timeout_count >= 100 * timeout:\r\n                break\r\n            time.sleep(0.01)\r\n    return data\r\n\r\n``` \r\n\r\nThe quickest way to solve this is to `Write command using standard raw REPL, 256 bytes every 10ms.`",
                        "label": "unlabeledBug",
                        "createdAt": "2022-05-22T20:42:27Z",
                        "closedAt": "2022-06-09T07:23:52Z",
                        "lastComment": "",
                        "commentCount": 0
                    }
                ]
            },

The shiny application, however, works as expected. Here's a minimal example (assuming that this is saved in app.R within the working directory 'myfolder'\r\n\r\n``` r\r\nlibrary(shiny)\r\nlibrary(gridlayout)\r\nlibrary(bslib)\r\n\r\n\r\nui <- navbarPage(\r\n  title = \"Chick Weights\",\r\n  selected = \"Empty Tab\",\r\n  collapsible = TRUE,\r\n  theme = bslib::bs_theme(),\r\n  tabPanel(\r\n    title = \"Empty Tab\",\r\n    grid_container(\r\n      layout = c(\r\n        \"nums square\",\r\n        \"nums square\"\r\n      ),\r\n      row_sizes = c(\r\n        \"1fr\",\r\n        \"1fr\"\r\n      ),\r\n      col_sizes = c(\r\n        \"1fr\",\r\n        \"1fr\"\r\n      ),\r\n      gap_size = \"10px\",\r\n      grid_card(\r\n        area = \"nums\",\r\n        full_screen = TRUE,\r\n        card_header(\"Header\"),\r\n        card_body_fill(\r\n          sliderInput(\r\n            inputId = \"inputId\",\r\n            label = \"Slider Input\",\r\n            min = 0,\r\n            max = 10,\r\n            value = 5,\r\n            width = \"100%\"\r\n          )\r\n        )\r\n      ),\r\n      grid_card(\r\n        area = \"square\",\r\n        full_screen = TRUE,\r\n        card_header(\"Header\"),\r\n        card_body_fill(textOutput(outputId = \"squared\"))\r\n      )\r\n    )\r\n  )\r\n)\r\n\r\n\r\nserver <- function(input, output) {\r\n  numsqr <- reactive({input$inputId ^ 2})\r\n\r\noutput$squared <- renderText({\r\n  paste0(\"the square of \", input$inputId, \" is \", numsqr())\r\n})\r\n\r\n}\r\n\r\nshinyApp(ui, server)\r\n\r\n```\r\n\r\nThen, running \r\n```r\r\nshinyuieditor::launch_editor(app_loc = \"myfolder/\")\r\n```\r\n Do not open the editor, as can be seen in the following                     {
                        "title": "Make nodes reusable across pipelines",
                        "description": "I'm not sure if I have missed something since the documentation is very limited up to now. I would consider it one of the most important features of a tool like dataplane to not only create nodes once (e.g. a python code block) but being able to reuse this node in other pipelines as well. \r\nTo do that, we would need something like a central library to look for existing nodes so that you could drag&drop them into your pipeline in the same way as you do it for processors right now, but instead of being empty or with the default \"print(\"Node-ID\")\" statements it would contain the code that was already written in another pipeline.\r\nIdeally, you would also have some git integration for that, because if you write a significant amount of code, you surely want it to be versioned. Presumably, you could simulate that by running a bash script to clone a git repository and execute it, but than you loose the advantage of the built-in editor. ",

                        "title": "Issue: Prettier config file missing",
                        "description": "### What is the issue?\r\n\r\nNowadays everyone uses [Prettier](https://prettier.io/), An automated code formatting tool.\r\n\r\nThe issue is everyone have different **global settings** of prettier according to their style. BUT this can **cause useless changes** to opensource projects as many people works on same code.\r\n\r\nSo having a `prettier config file` inside project directory can resolve this issue.\r\n\r\n### How to solve this issue?\r\n\r\nadding a file `.prettierrc` and `.prettierignore` will solve this issue\r\n",

                        "title": "🐛 [BUG] - Create multiple accounts using same email and username",
                        "description": "### Description\n\nUsers can create multiple accounts using the same email address as long as the case is different. For example, \"user@gmail.com\" and \"USER@gmail.com\" are treated as different emails. This is a problem creates confusion when trying to identify unique users.\r\n\r\nThe same issue exists with the username field. Users can create multiple accounts using the same username as long as the case is different.\r\n\r\n\r\nIt should treat email addresses and usernames as case-insensitive when creating new accounts. If an email or username has already been used to create an account, the website should prevent the creation of a new account using the same email or username with different case.\r\n\n\n### Reproduction URL\n\nhttps://noteslify.stonecss.com/\n\n### Reproduction steps\n\n```bash\n1. Go to the website and click the \"Get Started\" button.\r\n2. Enter \"user@example.com\" as the email and \"USER\" as the username.\r\n3. Click the \"Register\" button.\r\n4. Observe that a new account is created.\r\n5. Repeat steps 2-4 using the same email and username with different case (e.g. \"USeR@example.com\" and \"USeR\").\r\n6.                         "title": "Feat: Add greeting bot",
                        "description": "### Describe the feature\n\nProposal: Greeting Bot for GitHub with Automated Acknowledgment\r\n\r\nDescription: The Greeting Bot for GitHub is an intelligent chatbot designed to provide warm greetings and valuable information to new contributors and users on GitHub repositories. It enhances the onboarding experience by creating a welcoming atmosphere and offers automated acknowledgment in case no one is available to reply. It ensures that newcomers receive guidance and assistance even in the absence of immediate human interaction.\r\n\r\nFeatures:\r\n1. Personalized Greetings: Delivers tailored greetings based on user information, fostering a friendly and engaging environment.\r\n2. Automated Acknowledgment: If no one is available to reply or acknowledge the greeting, the bot provides predefined responses, ensuring users feel acknowledged and supported.\r\n3. Welcome Message and Resources: Provides a comprehensive welcome message, including links to relevant resources, guidelines, and documentation to help users get started.\r\n4. Multi-platform Integration: Seamlessly integrates with GitHub repositories, extending greetings and support across various platforms, such as websites, mobile apps, and social media.\r\n5. Customizable Settings: Offers flexibility in customizing the bot's behavior, allowing repository owners to define fallback responses, timing intervals, and other parameters as per their specific needs.\r\n\r\nBy implementing the Greeting Bot for GitHub with automated acknowledgment, repositories can ensure that new users receive a warm welcome and valuable information, fostering a positive onboarding experience, even when immediate human interaction may not be possible.\n\n### Add ScreenShots\n\n![image](https://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/96341431/fda73981-0131-458b-8044-a5a4b173ce5b)\r\n\n\n### Record\n\n- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct\n- [X] I'm a GSSOC'23 contributor\n- [X] I want to work on this issue",

                    {
                        "title": "💡 [FEATURE]: ACCESSIBILITY IMPROVEMENTS OF SOCIAL ANCHORS ON FOOTER",
                        "description": "### Feature idea\r\n- Improving the Accessibility of Social anchors on `footer` section\r\n\r\n\r\n### Describe the solution you'd like\r\n- This solution is adding `aria-label` for social anchors (links like Github) which are placed inside the `footer` element\r\n\r\n- it is important to note that we want to add the `title` attribute also. This is because the `title` attribute is intended to provide additional information to screen reader users.\r\n\r\n- The `aria-label` attribute is a way more important for providing accessibility information to screen reader users. The `aria-label` attribute is an Accessible Rich Internet Applications (ARIA) attribute that can be used to provide a label for an element. This label is then read aloud by screen readers, providing additional information about the element to the user.\r\n\r\n- In general, the `aria-label` & `title` attributes are preferred for providing accessibility information to screen reader users.\r\n\r\n- You can consider to assign this issue to me to make the site accessible for screen readers\r\n\r\n\r\n### Screenshot (Going to make changes on these elements)\r\n![image](https://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/92252895/489f95c3-c662-437c-bcaa-b3c7d8730247)\r\n\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [X] I have checked the existing issues\r\n- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct\r\n- [X] I am willing to work on this issue\r\n- [X] I am a GSSoC'23 contributor\r\n\r\n----",

                    {
                        "title": "Add Auto Comment Feature to Improve Collaboration",
                        "description": "**Issue Description:**\r\nAs an active contributor to your open-source project, I believe that implementing an auto-comment feature would greatly enhance collaboration and communication within the project. This feature would automatically generate comments in response to specific events, such as when an issue is opened, a pull request is created, an issue is assigned, or an issue is unassigned.\r\n\r\n**Feature Details:**\r\n- When an issue is opened, the auto-comment should greet the author and provide a brief acknowledgement and request for additional context.\r\n- When a pull request is opened, the auto-comment should greet the author, express gratitude, and remind them to follow the project's contributing guidelines.\r\n- When an issue is closed, the auto-comment should thank the author for their contribution and encourage further engagement.\r\n- When an issue is assigned to someone, the auto-comment should notify the assignee and encourage them to start working on it.\r\n- When an issue is unassigned from someone, the auto-comment should notify the assignee about the change and suggest reassignment if they are offline.\r\n\r\n**Benefits:**\r\n- Improved communication and engagement with contributors.\r\n- Provides clear instructions and acknowledgements for various events.\r\n- Enhances collaboration by setting expectations and providing reminders.\r\n- Reduces manual effort by automating comment generation.\r\n\r\n**Acceptance Criteria:**\r\n- The auto-comment feature should be implemented using the \"wow-actions/auto-comment\" GitHub Action.\r\n- Comments should be appropriately customized for each event, mentioning relevant parties and providing the necessary information.\r\n- The auto-comment workflow should trigger on the following events: issues opened, pull requests opened, issues closed, issues assigned, and issues unassigned.\r\n- The feature should be added to the project's existing GitHub Actions workflow file.\r\n\r\n**Additional Context:**\r\nFeel free to ask any questions or seek clarification regarding the auto-comment feature. I'm excited about contributing to your project and believe this enhancement will greatly benefit its community.\r\n\r\n",

                    {
                        "title": " Redundant and Confusing Redirection of \"Get Started\" Button on About Page",
                        "description": "**Describe the bug**\r\nThere is a usability issue with the \"Get Started\" button on the About page. Currently, when clicked, the button redirects users to the home page, which already contains a \"Get Started\" button that further redirects users to the sign-in page. This redundancy and confusion in the user flow need to be addressed.\r\n\r\n<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->\r\n**Problem Description:**\r\nThe current redirection of the \"Get Started\" button on the About page creates a redundant user experience. Users are directed to the home page, where they encounter another \"Get Started\" button that leads to the sign-in page. This unnecessary redirection adds confusion and may deter users from efficiently accessing the sign-in page.\r\n\r\n**Proposed Solution:**\r\nTo improve the user experience and eliminate redundancy: \r\n\r\n1. Directly redirect users to the sign-in page: The code associated with the \"Get Started\" button on the About page can be modified to directly redirect users to the sign-in page. This approach eliminates the extra step of navigating to the home page and subsequently clicking the \"Get Started\" button again.\r\n\r\n2. Renaming the button for clarity: If the \"Get Started\" button on the About page is intended to serve a different purpose than the one on the home page, consider renaming it to reflect its specific function. For example, it could be renamed to \"Learn More\" or \"Explore Features\" to provide a clearer indication of the action users will take when clicking the button.\r\n\r\n**Screen recording of the problem**\r\n\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/62384655/163e42c1-bbfa-4116-ae19-0938750c1f73\r\n",

                        "title": "Dark Mode, Link Colors, Active Link, and Sign-In Button Improvements",
                        "description": "The website requires several enhancements to improve the overall user experience and visual aesthetics. The following issues have been identified:\r\n\r\n1. Dark Mode Inconsistency:\r\nThe dark mode feature is only functioning properly in the navbar, but it should be extended to other sections of the website as well. Ensure that the dark mode theme is applied consistently throughout all pages.\r\n\r\n2. Link Colors and Animation:\r\nThe current link colors lack visual appeal and may not provide enough contrast against the background. Consider improving the link colors to enhance readability. Additionally, introduce a subtle animation effect, such as color transition or underline, to indicate interactivity when hovering over the links.\r\n\r\n3. Active Link Highlight:\r\nWhen navigating through the website, it's important to visually highlight the active link to provide clear feedback to the user. Implement a distinct visual cue, such as a different color or underline, to indicate the currently active page or section.\r\n\r\n4. Sign-In Button Improvement:\r\nThe design of the sign-in button needs enhancement. It should be visually appealing and easily noticeable. Consider using a different color, style, or placement to make it stand out and encourage users to sign in.\r\n\r\n### Proposed Solution:\r\nTo address these issues and improve the website:\r\n\r\n1. Extend the dark mode feature to all sections of the website, ensuring consistency across pages.\r\n\r\n2. Improve the link colors to enhance readability and introduce a subtle animation effect to indicate interactivity.\r\n\r\n3. Implement a visual cue to highlight the active link, such as a different color or underline, to provide clear feedback to users.\r\n\r\n4. Enhance the design of the sign-in button to make it visually appealing and encourage user engagement.\r\n",

                        "description": "### Description\r\nWhen accessing the site on a mobile device, there is a horizontal scroll that allows scrolling from left to right. This issue occurs when the elements in the UI do not adjust properly to the mobile viewport, resulting in an inconvenient user experience.\r\n\r\n### Goals\r\nThe main goal of this issue is to improve the responsiveness of the UI for mobile devices. By fixing this issue, mobile users will be able to access the site without any horizontal scrolling or layout issues.\r\n\r\n### Proposed Solution\r\nTo address this issue, the following steps could be considered:\r\n\r\n1.                     {
                        "title": "sign in page is sending \"GET\" request instead of \"POST\" request",
                        "description": "i observed that the sign in page is sending GET request which is use less for functional requirements like Sign in. GET request do't have body hence the data intered by user will be sent to the server using path parameters or query parameters which is heighly unsecure way to send data to server. i can make the sign in process more secure as well as proper in will send all the informations in encryped format using an npm packege (bcrypt). the sensative data (like password and email) will be send to server in the form of JSON object to the server and in body of post request and hence will not be visible in URL and that too in encrypted form. \r\n\r\nin this way the whole sign in process will be heighly secure. i will implement this to sign up page also because both sign in and sign up pages will have to access same data base. i will integrate \"sqlite data base\" using npm pakeges like \"sqlite\" and \r\n\"sqlite3\" hence data entered will be saved in server that too in encrypted format and can be verified at the time of sign in process. \r\n\r\nwhen the server will receave sign in request server will generate a personal access token to user in body of response through which user will not have to enter password again untill and unless the token is expired. \r\n\r\nbasically i wanted to conclude with last words which are, i will transform login and sign up system of this website which is nearly nothing in site currently. \r\n\r\ni am attaching the screen short of sign in attempt which i have made and screen shot of header of request made which is proving that request make is a GET request. this login and sign up system is at a very nascent stage, needs to improve alot in which i can realy support organisation. please assign under GSSoC'23.\r\n\r\n![Screenshot from 2023-05-21 17-45-07](https://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/97947258/80b5a2ac-80d8-4393-a4b5-6015d23cfed9)\r\n![Screenshot from 2023-05-21 17-47-37](https://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/97947258/4e37da84-596b-43f3-aa52-4806228a0969)\r\n",

                        "title": "Cursor not changing on hover for the \"Get Started\" button",
                        "description": "### I encounter that cursor not changing on hover for the \"Get Started\" button\r\n\r\n**Description**:\r\nI have encountered an issue where the cursor does not change when hovering over the \"Get Started\" button on the webpage. Currently, the cursor remains in its default state, indicating that the button is not interactive.\r\n\r\n**Observation**:\r\nUpon investigating the issue, I noticed that the cursor does not change when hovering over the \"Get Started\" button. This behavior is inconsistent with user expectations and may lead to confusion or frustration.\r\n\r\n**Proposed Solution**:\r\nTo address this issue, I suggest adding the CSS property cursor: \"pointer\" to the style definition of the \"Get Started\" button. This will change the cursor to a pointer icon, indicating that the button is clickable and interactive.\r\n\r\n**Visual Representation**:\r\nHere is a comparison of the button's appearance before and after implementing the suggested CSS property:\r\n\r\n\r\nBefore ⤵️ \r\n\r\n![change 1](https://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/103810119/da4c0e06-5ff2-499e-a782-9f585d346d0d)\r\n\r\n \r\n**After** ⤵️ \r\n\r\n![change1 after](https://github.com/MonalikaPatnaik/UMatter/assets/103810119/5f8d1345-20e4-4e76-854b-15b611bedb83)\r\n\r\n\r\n### Can you please assign this issue to me? if you think it's important so that I can resolve it?\r\n",

                    {
                        "title": "下载音乐的命名与后缀问题",
                        "description": "![image](https://github.com/Project-And-Factory/BlurLyric/assets/103353940/4b9ef6fd-7661-41cd-a008-a7f0bb615c8e)\r\n![image](https://github.com/Project-And-Factory/BlurLyric/assets/103353940/6a4c2a43-64ac-433a-a1c2-394bcd835569)\r\n![image](https://github.com/Project-And-Factory/BlurLyric/assets/103353940/bd537455-e18d-413a-ba5c-d58f253a6b9e)\r\n\r\n1. 文件下载不会给音乐命名，统一起名``mp3.mp3``，后续手动写入音乐名需要手动码字，而某些字符不是键盘能直接输入的。\r\n2. 上述两个音乐下载下来的时候，网易云API都是请求到无损/Hi-Res音质的，文件编码应该都是FLAC，但程序根据惯例把下载的文件统一命名成了``mp3.mp3``。\r\n\r\n**预希望的两种解决方式**\r\n- 在blob下载的时候把名字写进去；或使用剪切板把文件名写入，在“另存为”的时候就可以直接粘贴\r\n- 通过下载链接或文件码率快速判断文件后缀（如320Kbps及以下判定MP3，320Kbps以上判定FLAC）\r\n\r\n\r\n> *另注：*\r\n> *就“文件码率”计算，程序对FLAC文件的演算似乎和Windows右击菜单“属性”的有不一样的地方？有一个文件，BlurLyric显示2000K，Windows却显示只有1500Kbps*",

                        "title": "Add JOI schema validator to improve data validation",
                        "description": "Problem:\r\nCurrently, the system lacks a robust data validation mechanism, resulting in potential data inconsistencies and errors. This leads to difficulties in maintaining data integrity and can cause issues throughout the application.\r\n\r\nSolution:\r\nIntegrate JOI schema validator into the system to enhance data validation capabilities. JOI is a powerful validation library for JavaScript that provides a declarative way to define data validation rules. By incorporating JOI, we can easily define and enforce data validation rules, ensuring that data entered into the system meets the required criteria.\r\n\r\nThere are various other alternatives that are considered:\r\n1.) Roll our own validation solution: Developing a custom validation solution would be time-consuming and error-prone. It would require significant effort to handle various validation scenarios effectively.\r\n\r\n2.) Use other existing validation libraries: While there are other validation libraries available, JOI stands out due to its extensive features, flexibility, and widespread adoption. It provides a rich set of validation rules and allows for complex validations with ease.\r\n\r\nWithout a proper data validation mechanism, the system is prone to accepting invalid or inconsistent data. This can lead to issues such as corrupted data, application crashes, and incorrect processing. By adding a JOI schema validator, we can ensure that data entered into the system adheres to the defined validation rules, improving overall data quality and system reliability.\r\n\r\nI am eager to formally contribute to this issue, utilizing my expertise and skills to provide valuable insights and potential solutions.",

                    {
                        "title": "Add Auto Comment Feature to Improve Collaboration",
                        "description": "**Issue Description:**\r\nAs an active contributor to your open-source project, I believe that implementing an auto-comment feature would greatly enhance collaboration and communication within the project. This feature would automatically generate comments in response to specific events, such as when an issue is opened, a pull request is created, an issue is assigned, or an issue is unassigned.\r\n\r\n**Feature Details:**\r\n- When an issue is opened, the auto-comment should greet the author and provide a brief acknowledgement and request for additional context.\r\n- When a pull request is opened, the auto-comment should greet the author, express gratitude, and remind them to follow the project's contributing guidelines.\r\n- When an issue is closed, the auto-comment should thank the author for their contribution and encourage further engagement.\r\n- When an issue is assigned to someone, the auto-comment should notify the assignee and encourage them to start working on it.\r\n- When an issue is unassigned from someone, the auto-comment should notify the assignee about the change and suggest reassignment if they are offline.\r\n\r\n**Benefits:**\r\n- Improved communication and engagement with contributors.\r\n- Provides clear instructions and acknowledgements for various events.\r\n- Enhances collaboration by setting expectations and providing reminders.\r\n- Reduces manual effort by automating comment generation.\r\n\r\n**Acceptance Criteria:**\r\n- The auto-comment feature should be implemented using the \"wow-actions/auto-comment\" GitHub Action.\r\n- Comments should be appropriately customized for each event, mentioning relevant parties and providing the necessary information.\r\n- The auto-comment workflow should trigger on the following events: issues opened, pull requests opened, issues closed, issues assigned, and issues unassigned.\r\n- The feature should be added to the project's existing GitHub Actions workflow file.\r\n\r\n**Additional Context:**\r\nFeel free to ask any questions or seek clarification regarding the auto-comment feature. I'm excited about contributing to your project and believe this enhancement will greatly benefit its community.\r\n\r\n",

                        "title": "[BUG] : aria-label, title, rel, target for Social Icons in Footer Section and Other Minor Bugs in Some Pages",
                        "description": "### Description\n\n-  **`aria-label, title, rel, target for Social Icons in Footer Section and Other Minor Bugs in Some Pages`**\r\n- **In Some Files, `alt text is not Given`**\r\n- **In `Form Sections, chances to add aria-label attributes in Some Code Based Files`**\n\n### Screenshots\n\n_No response_\n\n### Any additional information?\n\n- The aria-label attribute provides a way to place a descriptive text label on an object, such as a link, when there are no elements visible on the page that describe the object.\r\n- The text of the title attribute is displayed as a tooltip in most browsers — it appears in a small bubble when the cursor hovers over the link\r\n- The target attribute specifies where the linked document will open when the link is clicked. The default is the current window. If target=\"_blank\" , the linked document will open in a new tab or (on older browsers) a new window.\r\n- The required alt attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed. The alt attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader).\n\n### What browser are you seeing the problem on?\n\nChrome\n\n### Checklist\n\n- [X] I have checked the existing issues\n- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rupali-codes/LinksHub/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)\n- [X] I have read the discussion tab thoroughly and got the project idea\n- [X] I am willing to work on this issue (optional)\n- [X] I am a GSSoC'23 contributor",

                        "title": "[BUG] 🚨🔥 Urgent Issue: Important Functionality Removed after Next.js Migration 🔥🚨",
                        "description": "### Description\n\nDue to the recent migration of Informaticon to Next.js, several crucial functionalities have been unintentionally removed from the website. The functionalities affected include Book Search, Google Book Viewer, and Google Login.\r\n\r\nFunctionalities Affected:\r\n1. **Book Search**: The Book Search feature, which allowed users to search for books based on various criteria, is no longer available on the website.\r\n\r\n2. **Google Book Viewer**: The Google Book Viewer, which provided a seamless way for users to preview books before making a decision, is no longer accessible.\r\n\r\n3. **Google Login**: The integration of Google Login that enabled users to sign in using their Google accounts has been removed, resulting in a less user-friendly authentication process.\r\n\r\n\r\nImpact:\r\nThe removal of these functionalities significantly impacts the user experience and may lead to decreased user engagement on the platform. As these features were highly appreciated by our community members, it is crucial to address this issue urgently to retain our users and maintain the website's functionality.\r\n\r\nProposed Solution:\r\nI will take immediate action to restore the Book Search, Google Book Viewer, and Google Login functionalities. The proposed solution includes the following steps:\r\n\r\n1. **Reimplement Book Search**: I will reinstate the Book Search feature, ensuring that users can search for books by title, author, genre, or any other relevant criteria.\r\n\r\n2. **Restore Google Book Viewer**: I will reintegrate the Google Book Viewer to allow users to preview book content directly on the website.\r\n\r\n3. **Reestablish Google Login**: The Google Login functionality will be reinstated, providing users with a seamless and secure sign-in process using their Google accounts.\r\n\r\nNext Steps:\r\n1. Identify the cause of the functionalities' removal during the Next.js migration.\r\n2. Implement the necessary changes to restore the Book Search, Google Book Viewer, and Google Login features.\r\n3.                     {
                        "title": "[BUG] Middleware Buggy Code",
                        "description": "### Description\n\nIn the auth middleware code there is **no response**. If the middleware fails to authorize the user there is **no response sent back to the frontend** that will tell the frontend that the authorization fails.\r\n\r\n**Solution**\r\nHence,  we need to add the response to the middleware that will be received in the frontend if the user is not authorized and when the frontend receives this error of authorization it will redirect the page to the login form.\r\n\r\nA response for the unauthorized request is necessary because if we don't add it and the middleware fails to authorize a user then there will be no response from the requested route that has the middleware in it.\r\n\r\nI will also add the try-catch in the middleware for better error handling\r\n\n\n### Screenshots\n\n_No response_\n\n### Any additional information?\n\n_No response_\n\n### What browser are you seeing the problem on?\n\nChrome\n\n### Checklist\n\n- [X] I have checked the existing issues\n- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rupali-codes/LinksHub/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)\n- [X] I have read the discussion tab thoroughly and got the project idea\n- [X] I am willing to work on this issue (optional)\n- [X] I am a GSSoC'23 contributor",

                    {
                        "title": "[BUG] 🛡️ Hide Sensitive Server Hosted Link from Project's .env File 🤐🔒",
                        "description": "### Description\n\nCurrently, the project's sensitive server hosted link, containing various POST requests and critical endpoints, is directly exposed in the project's code. This poses a significant security risk, as anyone with access to the codebase can potentially misuse this information and compromise the application's security. 😱🚨\r\n\r\nTo enhance security and protect sensitive information, we need to refactor the code and move the server hosted link to the .env file. By doing so, the link will be hidden from the project's source code, and only authorized personnel with access to the .env file will be able to see and modify it. 🙅‍♂️💻🔐\r\n\r\nThis change will significantly reduce the risk of security breaches and unauthorized access to critical endpoints, ensuring the application remains secure and protected from potential threats. 🚀🔒\n\n### Screenshots\n\n![image](https://github.com/rohansx/informatician/assets/85815172/2d6e929d-a269-4908-8fec-ec5ef2c57c32)\r\n\n\n### Any additional information?\n\n_No response_\n\n### What browser are you seeing the problem on?\n\n_No response_\n\n### Checklist\n\n- [X] I have checked the existing issues\n- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rupali-codes/LinksHub/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)\n- [X] I have read the discussion tab thoroughly and got the project idea\n- [X] I am willing to work on this issue (optional)\n- [X] I am a GSSoC'23 contributor",

                    {
                        "title": "[BUG] Missing proper alt attributes on img tags",
                        "description": "### Description\r\n\r\nMany people just write one or two words explaining about the image in alt attributes which is not the correct way to describe the image.\r\n\r\n**Benefits of enhancing the alt attributes include:**\r\n\r\nAccessibility: Alt attributes provide essential information to individuals who cannot see the images directly, allowing them to understand the visual content through alternative text descriptions.\r\n\r\nCompliance: By following best practices and guidelines, such as those outlined in the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), we can ensure our project meets accessibility standards, which is important for inclusivity and legal compliance.\r\n\r\nSEO (Search Engine Optimization): Meaningful alt attributes can improve search engine rankings by providing search engines with more context about the images. This can result in increased visibility and organic traffic to our project.\r\n\r\n### Screenshots\r\n\r\n![Screenshot (518)](https://github.com/rohansx/informatician/assets/56786344/b550707a-7d71-45d6-a008-404527b300d8)\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [X] I have checked the existing issues\r\n- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rupali-codes/LinksHub/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)\r\n- [X] I have read the discussion tab thoroughly and got the project idea\r\n- [X] I am willing to work on this issue (optional)\r\n- [X] I am a GSSoC'23 contributor",

                        "title": "[BUG] Fixing Add Books Form Not Working Due to Incorrect POST Request Address",
                        "description": "### Description\n\nThe Add Books form in our application is currently not functioning as expected. The issue arises from the incorrect POST request address being used, which is set to \"http://localhost:5000/api/book/add.\" This incorrect address prevents the form data from being submitted successfully.                     {
                        "title": "Add Auto Comment Feature to Improve Collaboration",
                        "description": "**Issue Description:**\r\nAs an active contributor to your open-source project, I believe that implementing an auto-comment feature would greatly enhance collaboration and communication within the project. This feature would automatically generate comments in response to specific events, such as when an issue is opened, a pull request is created, an issue is assigned, or an issue is unassigned.\r\n\r\n**Feature Details:**\r\n- When an issue is opened, the auto-comment should greet the author and provide a brief acknowledgement and request for additional context.\r\n- When a pull request is opened, the auto-comment should greet the author, express gratitude, and remind them to follow the project's contributing guidelines.\r\n- When an issue is closed, the auto-comment should thank the author for their contribution and encourage further engagement.\r\n- When an issue is assigned to someone, the auto-comment should notify the assignee and encourage them to start working on it.\r\n- When an issue is unassigned from someone, the auto-comment should notify the assignee about the change and suggest reassignment if they are offline.\r\n\r\n**Benefits:**\r\n- Improved communication and engagement with contributors.\r\n- Provides clear instructions and acknowledgements for various events.\r\n- Enhances collaboration by setting expectations and providing reminders.\r\n- Reduces manual effort by automating comment generation.\r\n\r\n**Acceptance Criteria:**\r\n- The auto-comment feature should be implemented using the \"wow-actions/auto-comment\" GitHub Action.\r\n- Comments should be appropriately customized for each event, mentioning relevant parties and providing the necessary information.\r\n- The auto-comment workflow should trigger on the following events: issues opened, pull requests opened, issues closed, issues assigned, and issues unassigned.\r\n- The feature should be added to the project's existing GitHub Actions workflow file.\r\n\r\n**Additional Context:**\r\nFeel free to ask any questions or seek clarification regarding the auto-comment feature. I'm excited about contributing to your project and believe this enhancement will greatly benefit its community.\r\n\r\n",
