                        "title": "[Suggestion] HT's TreeChop",
                        "description": "Yes, FTB Ultimine is included already and allows for quick tree chopping, but this mod is quite different, and there are several reasons why an admin would want to limit FTB Ultimine's functionalities (it also makes 3x3 upgrades for some tools quite pointless).\r\n\r\nIt basically allows you to chop the whole tree by chopping the same block multiple times (the number of chops required depends on the amount of logs the tree you're chopping is made of). It's fairly balanced, you still consume hunger and durability of the tool you're using for every single chop you do.\r\nIt also integrates with WTHIT so you get information on how long is gonna take to chop the whole tree.\r\n\r\nTested version on AOF6 v1.3: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/treechop/files/4147540\r\n\r\nNo issues found, even FTB Ultimine's \"conflict\" (it's not an actual conflict after all) seems to generate no issues.",

                        "title": "[Bug]:  Incompatibility of Cards on Guide and Schedule Pages with Night Mode",
                        "description": "### What happened?\n\nHi there! I hope you're doing well. I'd like to bring to your attention an incompatibility issue I've noticed with the night mode feature in your repository. While the night mode itself works great, there seems to be a problem with the display of cards on both the Guide and Schedule pages.\r\n\r\nWhen the night mode is enabled, the cards on these pages appear to have insufficient contrast or inappropriate styling, making them difficult to read or distinguish from one another. This significantly hinders the overall user experience, especially for those who rely on the night mode for accessibility or personal preference reasons.\r\n\r\nTo resolve this issue, I suggest reviewing the styles applied to the cards on the Guide and Schedule pages when the night mode is active.                     {
                        "title": "Bug - URL prefetch impacts functionality in Chrome's new tab.",
                        "description": "It looks like Chrome is prefetching (I think with `onBeforeNavigate`) the DID information when a URL is being entered into a new tab. This sounds like desired functionality from a performance perspective, but it appears to create a bug in the extension on Chrome.\r\n\r\nThe general flow for web page loading looks like this: \r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118477/236666844-b2226a1e-e11d-46fd-8a5e-1dabfab197c4.png)\r\n\r\n\r\nI tested this using my latest fork, but I also confirmed it is present in `1.1.0` on the web store. \r\n\r\n### To reproduce:\r\n\r\n1. On the new tab page type in a URL that will return a DID (e.g. `https://washingtonpost.com`), but don't press enter yet. \r\n2. As soon as Chrome knows enough about the URL, the icon will turn blue.\r\n  a. This occurs when the complete URL is typed, or a previously visited URL is auto-completed.\r\n3. Press enter to visit the URL - the page loads and the icon turns gray when it should still be blue (bug).\r\n4. Reload the page and it turns blue (normal behavior).\r\n\r\n### Before Loading:\r\n\r\n<img width=\"698\" alt=\"image\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118477/236666309-de32e27b-9856-4263-9ede-88a283bf83a9.png\">\r\n\r\n### After Loading (bugged):\r\n\r\n<img width=\"692\" alt=\"image\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118477/236666338-76db0e8a-3c47-4329-bfb2-fac6185b19ad.png\">\r\n\r\n### After Reload (working):\r\n\r\n<img width=\"695\" alt=\"image\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118477/236666395-0c62c4c7-eb84-49b8-bce5-f0a109a073ca.png\">\r\n\r\nThis doesn't happen when entering a URL on an already loaded web page, only the new tab page\r\n\r\nThis behavior does not appear in Firefox or Firefox nightly, as it appears they don't implement the same prefetching on the new tab page.\r\n\r\n### Potential Solutions\r\n\r\n1. Find a way to preserve the state (blue icon) between the prefetch detection and the first page load. e.g. in the example above, the icon would remain blue in all 3 screenshot states. With a cursory glance, I'm unsure of the level of effort or how to go about this, but it's probably the best solution.\r\n2. Add the `webNavigation` permission to the manifests and edit `content.js` so the extension waits until the `onCommitted` state is hit. Unfortunately I haven't figured out a way to get this working yet and it's also undesirable permission scope creep. \r\n\r\nOpen to any ideas others may have, and I'll take a look with fresh eyes tomorrow. 😴",

                        "title": "[BUG] Race condition on /api/user/buyHint",
                        "description": "There is a race condition when users, playing in team buy an hint.\r\n\r\nIf two users from the same team buy an hint at the same time, the point removed will be double.\r\n\r\nHere is a python script that reproduce the issue :\r\n\r\n```py\r\nimport requests\r\nfrom multiprocessing import Process\r\n\r\ndef send_req(req_sess):\r\n    print(req_sess.post(\"http://localhost:3001/api/user/buyHint\",json={\"challengeId\":\"645817f3589006900bacc956\",\"hintId\":\"9649\"}).json())\r\n\r\ndef connect(username,password,req_sess):\r\n    req_sess.post(\"http://localhost:3001/api/login\",json={\"username\":username,\"password\":password})\r\n\r\ns1 = requests.Session()\r\ns2 = requests.Session()\r\ns3 = requests.Session()\r\ns4 = requests.Session()\r\n\r\nconnect(\"aaaa\",\"aaaaaaaa\",s1)\r\nconnect(\"bbbb\",\"bbbbbbbb\",s2)\r\nconnect(\"cccc\",\"cccccccc\",s3)\r\nconnect(\"dddd\",\"dddddddd\",s4)\r\n\r\npool = []\r\nthread = Process(target=send_req,args=(s1,))\r\npool.append(thread)\r\nthread = Process(target=send_req,args=(s2,))\r\npool.append(thread)\r\nthread = Process(target=send_req,args=(s3,))\r\npool.append(thread)\r\nthread = Process(target=send_req,args=(s4,))\r\npool.append(thread)\r\n\r\nfor p in pool:\r\n    p.start()\r\n```\r\n\r\nMaybe add (like for the flags) an array that contains the id of the team that he's buying a hint might be a great idea.",

                    {
                        "title": "Trying to reference a pad in snapToPad",
                        "description": "Hi. Just to understand the code better, I am trying to improve the snapToPad to return a reference, and I have some thoughts.\r\n\r\nThe way I thought could work would be from withing the `snapToPad` function. \r\n\r\n1. When a pad is hit, one grabs the identifier of the component and tries to find where it is referenced in the codemirror editor.\r\n2. If a variable referencing it is found, construction of the reference to be inserted becomes easy and it can be considered done.\r\n3. If a variable is not found, it is possible to prefix the line `board.add(\"comp...\")` with a variable such as `let comp1 = `. No problem.\r\n\r\nSo far so clear, but what makes it challenging is that the initial component definitions do not have a name or ID. So I wonder, maybe it makes sense to generate a random one on the fly. \r\n\r\nOK, this is something I realized while writing this and will try, but maybe there is something I am missing.",

                    {
                        "title": "浏览器插件不能使用http，只能用https",
                        "description": "关于http和https的问题\n\n1. 网页端由于要走代理，为了安全代理地址默认是使用https，http会直接返回失败。而直接在思源内部，没有这个限制，http和https都行\n\n2.  思源笔记内部没这个问题，是因为 cross-fetch 检测到服务器支持https之后，发现请求却是http，然后做了一次自动转发，将http转发为https\n\n3.  测试的http没问题，是因为如果服务器不支持https，请求不会转发。\n\n4. 走代理有问题是因为，请求代理这边，我默认不会进行请求转发，所以http请求返回之后直接返回，不会去管是否转发到https。这个下版本会优化\n\n![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3259282/221371066-13ad9a2b-71e3-460a-b530-550227274490.png)\n\n\n\n![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3259282/221372395-41423df8-2cd3-43c5-b4c9-223ce958a2b0.png)\n\n\n参考：\n\nhttps://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Redirections\n\nhttps://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/307",
